content.description:
Sit start the thin and sharp semi-prominent flake just right of the finger crack and head up before reaching out left for a good hold and top out.   

  It is a little technical as the feet aren't great.
content.protection: Pad, but it has a good landing.
content.location: This ascends the sharp, left-facing flake just right of finger crack.  Start sitting with a crimp on the right and the left in a flake.

content.description: This is 20-25 foot long and 10 or so foot tall wall that varies from vertical to slightly overhanging.  It has several decent warm up lines on it including two cracks.   All can be done with sit starts and the landing is as good as it gets in the woods.  There are good crimps on the face but some of the edges are a little crumbly.   The flake climb listed is the only real stand out but you can quickly do 7-8 lines here.  A traverse is also likely.
